intro: Lippia dumetorum, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a creeping or erect growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lippia dumetorum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
